meanings.definition: To employ too many staff members.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant was overstaffing for the lunch rush.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to cut costs by avoiding overstaffing.
meanings.sent3: The party was so small that overstaffing the event seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overstaffing with flowers, creating a colorful display.
meanings.sent5: Overstaffing the project with too many workers led to confusion and delays.

meanings.definition: The act of having an excessive number of employees.
meanings.sent1: Overstaffing can lead to inefficiency in the workplace.
meanings.sent2: The manager addressed the issue of overstaffing in the department.
meanings.sent3: The movie theater's overstaffing on a slow night made the employees bored.
meanings.sent4: The overstaffing of birds on the tree branches created a chirping symphony.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overstaffing were evident in the budget cuts that followed.
